name: AdvanceDirectivesContentType
title: Advance Directives Content Type
description: Grouper created to permit Advance Directive entry Content Types to be expressed using LOINC.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: Concepts which are used to identify a type of entry content that is relevant as an Advance Directive including the appointment of healthcare agents, as well as other care experience preferences, treatment intervention preferences, health goals, and priorities.),(Data Element Scope: These concepts can be used as the range of answers to the question, what type of information is included in a person's advance directive? Or individual concepts from this value set can be used to code/find the actual wishes of the patient for each of these areas where future planning preferences can be expressed.),(Inclusion Criteria: ),(Exclusion Criteria: )

contains.display: Goals, preferences, and priorities for medical treatment Narrative - Reported
Decision to inform doctors and nurses about the role religion, faith, culture, or spirituality play in my life Narrative - Reported
Preference on consulting a supportive and palliative care team to help treat physical, emotional, and spiritual discomfort and support family Narrative - Reported
Information to tell doctors if my health deteriorates due to a terminal illness and I am unable to interact meaningfully with family, friends, or surroundings Narrative - Reported

Information to tell doctors if I have a severe, irreversible brain injury or illness and can't dress, feed, or bathe myself, or communicate my medical wishes, but can be kept alive Narrative - Reported
Thoughts on cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) Narrative - Reported
Preferred location to spend final days if possible to choose Narrative - Reported
Thoughts on organ and tissue donations Narrative - Reported
Thoughts regarding autopsy Narrative - Reported
